item.title: Service Vehicles driving on park grass, 24th October
item.description:
The problem is re-occurring especially in the winter months where service vehicles and contractors are driving on the grass in the winter time when there is rain this creates a huge mud bath and ruins the grass understanding they have time frames to working which means cutting across the grass may save a few minutes however Winter hasn’t started and already the grass is being torn up and eroded by the vehicles driving in the park, can this stop?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Hill, Goddington, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole appearing on footpath and road., 24th October
item.description:
The footpath and road at this point is sinking a huge puddle of water and the trip hazard of the footpath creates a serious risk to pedestrians wheelchair users and prams. It is not just the pathway which is dangerous the corner of the road sinks down here the area needs to be made level and safe for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Hill, Goddington, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
